section.heading: Financial audit and reporting requirements.

para.text: The Bar Foundation shall provide the Council with:

An annual financial audit of its activities prepared by a certified public accountant licensed in the District of Columbia and carried out in accordance with generally accepted auditing standards; provided, that the audit may be conducted as part of the Bar Foundation's annual audit;
Biannual reporting that includes the following information:
The gender, race, ethnicity, and age of eligible individuals served;
The election ward of residence of eligible individuals served;
The incomes of eligible individuals served;
Legal services provided to eligible individuals; and
A list of designated legal services providers and the amount of grant funding provided to each, including how the grant funding is used by each designated legal services provider; and
An evaluation of the performance of each designated legal services provider;
The legal outcomes for each eligible individual or group served;
An evaluation of implementation challenges and recommendations for future improvements; and
An assessment of unmet legal needs in the provision of legal services for covered proceedings.
